The bands broadened with pressure ( Figure 7). As the pressure increased, the band gap decreased, which agrees with the red-shift of the absorption energy (to 564 nm, or 0.08 Ha at ca. 4 GPa) and which is also reflected in the sample’s spectacular color change from light yellow at standard pressure to dark red at 3.5 GPa ( Figure 8). The decrease of the band gap resulted uniformly from the energy levels of HOCO becoming less negative with pressure (destabilized by closer proximity of molecules within
